speaker: User
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 : This is PERSON_LASTNAME_2 from SMU Libraries. How may I help you?

speaker: User
message: [name13] : can i just double-check on how to cite this article with 3 authors? their names are PERSON_FIRSTNAME_3 PERSON_LASTNAME_1, PERSON_FIRSTNAME_2 PERSON_LASTNAME_4, and PERSON_FIRSTNAME_5 PERSON_LASTNAME_5

speaker: User
message: [name13] : so in this case, it will appear as ( PERSON_LASTNAME_1, H., PERSON_LASTNAME_4, R., & PERSON_LASTNAME_5, D, 2022) ?

speaker: User
message: [name13] : i see, so we dont have to put the other two author's names?

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 : Are you referring to in-text citation?

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 : Ok, we put the family name in the first place, followed by a ",". Then we put the abbreviations of first and middle names. In-between of these author names, we use "," and ", &" So, it will be PERSON_LASTNAME_1, H., PERSON_LASTNAME_4, R., & PERSON_LASTNAME_5, D.

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 : For in-text citations, we just need the family names. But when there are three or more authors, we only need to put the first author's family, followed by "et al."

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 : So, it would be PERSON_LASTNAME_1 et al., 2022) for in-text citation.
